summary: This document is a sealed grand jury subpoena and non-disclosure order issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Facebook, Inc. It commands Facebook to produce records for an Instagram account associated with Ghislaine Maxwell and prohibits Facebook from notifying the subscriber about the subpoena for 365 days. The subpoena is part of a federal criminal investigation into suspected felonies including sex trafficking.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and signed the accompanying letter to Facebook, Inc. as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena specifically requests all records for an Instagram account associated with the possible account name 'ghislainemaxwell6', indicating she is a target or subject of the grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the office issuing a grand jury subpoena for records related to Maxwell's alleged Instagram account as part of a criminal investigation.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena to Facebook
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a sealed grand jury subpoena to Facebook, Inc. demanding records for an Instagram account associated with Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Court Issues Sealed Non-Disclosure Order
events.description: A federal judge signs a sealed order under 18 U.S.C. § 2705(b) prohibiting Facebook from notifying the subscriber (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) about the subpoena for 365 days.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance/Record Production Deadline
events.description: The subpoena commands Facebook to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records to the FBI by this date.

locations: Silvio J. Mello Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
Federal Bureau of Investigation, 26 Federal Plaza, VCAC/Human Trafficking, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an active federal grand jury investigation into suspected violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 371 (conspiracy), 2422 (coercion and enticement), and 2423 (transportation of minors).
The investigation specifically targeted Ghislaine Maxwell, as the subpoena rider requests all records for an Instagram account associated with the possible account name 'ghislainemaxwell6'.

A federal judge issued a sealed non-disclosure order, preventing Facebook from notifying the account subscriber about the subpoena for 365 days, citing risks of flight, evidence destruction, witness intimidation, or jeopardizing the investigation.
The U.S. Attorney's Office also directed Facebook to preserve all existing information related to the specified account(s) for 90 days under 18 U.S.C. § 2703(f)(1).
The document demonstrates the ongoing, covert nature of the federal investigation into Maxwell in June 2020, prior to her arrest in July 2020.
